relevant_cases: 16243:US shows hypoechoic lesion in posterior thigh with prominent color Doppler flow signals (arterial and venous labeled A/V), MRI demonstrates serpiginous abnormal vascular channels abutting thickened sciatic nerve with fatty muscle atrophy - mirrors target case US inhomogeneous muscle mass with Doppler signals and MRI vascular replacement of muscle confirming high-flow vascular malformation;17667:US crooked hypoechoic interdigital lesion with color Doppler aliasing and spectral low-resistance high-velocity arterial flow (peak 274 cm/s), MRI T1 hypo mass with central nidus of linear hypointense flow voids on DP FS - classic high-flow AVM imaging distinguishing from low-flow VMs or sarcomas lacking flow voids;13949:Plain film and CT show cortical thickening and multiple lytic punch-out lesions in tibia/fibula without permeative pattern, MRI depicts abnormal serpiginous vessels in posterior calf muscles extending interosseously with T2 FS flow voids and early arterial enhancement - parallels target femoral diaphysis sclerosis/thickening and flow voids due to high-flow hyperemia;15905:US multiple tortuous anechoic tubular channels with power Doppler complete color saturation, high-velocity pulsatile arterial waveform (spectral broadening) and arterialized venous flow; MRI muscle infiltration with aneurysmal dilatations - direct match to target US well-defined squeezable mass with clear Doppler signals confirming high-flow pattern vs solid sarcomas

9439:Axial and coronal contrast-enhanced CT shows marked annular tumoural thickening of the ascending colon with luminal narrowing and multiple hypoattenuating liver lesions, confirming amoebic colitis/ameboma can produce similar concentric right colon wall thickening as target case;17728:CT and MRI demonstrate subtle but persistent caecal wall thickening, biopsy-confirmed amoebic colitis - matches target caecum involvement with mural edema;17079:Coronal and sagittal CT reveals diffuse wall thickening of ascending, transverse, and descending colon with thumbprinting (submucosal oedema), right pericolonic fat stranding, and ascites (spared ileum); distinguishes CMV colitis by extension beyond hepatic flexure

8494:MRI demonstrates hyperintense fluid collection in right iliacus muscle adjacent to SI joint with surrounding marrow signal changes in sacrum and ilium, mirroring the adjacent muscle high signal and sacral bone involvement seen in target case;10303:CT shows cortical erosions and irregularities at left SI joint involving sacrum and ilium with low-density abscess collections in iliopsoas, obturator, and gluteus minimus muscles, matching cortical loss at SI joint and adjacent muscle thickening in target;17605:MRI T2 hyperintensity in right sacral and iliac bone marrow adjacent to SI joint with peripheral enhancing abscesses in iliacus muscle, directly comparable to target hyperintense sacral lesion with soft tissue collection and enhancement;18506:MRI PDw fat-sat shows central low-signal bone sequestrum surrounded by hyperintense marrow edema and cortical cloacae with adjacent vastus muscle high signal myositis, exemplifying the low-signal central sequestrum and muscle involvement in target sacral osteomyelitis

11941:CT shows well-defined unilocular expansile cystic lesion in anterior mandible with cortical thinning and breach, mirroring the target case’s CT cystic unilocular mass with bone cortex thinning and defects;13229:CT bone window: expansile hypodense lesion with cortical thinning, loculations, and soft tissue window reveals peripheral enhancing septum akin to target’s enhancing mural nodule on medial wall;15243:MRI demonstrates multilocular solid/cystic mass with vivid enhancement of papillary solid projections and irregular margins, cortical thinning/erosion on CT, confirming enhancing solid components in ameloblastoma vs pure cyst;18495:CT exhibits cortical expansion, scalloping, thinning with soap-bubble multiloculated expansile lesion; enhancing solid papillary projections on CT/MRI match target’s intramural enhancing nodule and scalloped cystic borders;10867:CT/MRI show polycystic expansile lesion in posterior body/ramus with cortical deformation, fluid and parenchymatous components with heterogeneous enhancement, similar location and mixed cystic-solid features

1828:Sagittal and axial post-contrast MR show a lobulated, heterogeneously enhancing pineal mass with subsequent multiple nodular leptomeningeal and ependymal enhancing deposits ("sugar-icing" pattern) — demonstrates typical CSF dissemination of pineoblastoma.;6806:Sagittal T1 and post-contrast images show an irregular, heterogeneously enhancing pineal mass that invades the tectum and extends through the aqueduct causing obstructive hydrocephalus — illustrates aggressive, infiltrative behavior of pineoblastoma.

8890:MRI shows a well-defined tenosynovial mass isointense to muscle on T1 with no susceptibility artifacts on GRE (absence of hemosiderin) and collagenous hypocellular histology — imaging pattern supports fibroma of the tendon sheath (FTS);1066:GCTTS case with low-intermediate signal on T1 and T2 attributed to hemosiderin and strong post-contrast enhancement — demonstrates imaging features (hemosiderin-related low signal and marked enhancement) that help differentiate GCTTS from FTS;18540:Localized tenosynovial giant cell tumour showing T1 hypointense mass, areas of signal drop on susceptibility/FFE (blooming from hemosiderin) and prominent enhancement — useful to exclude FTS when susceptibility artifacts are present

17121:CT shows a thick-walled blind-ending tubular structure arising from the distal ileum separate from a normal appendix, with surrounding fat stranding and mesenteric lymphadenopathy — classic imaging for Meckel's diverticulitis and distinguishes it from appendicitis.;11923:Contrast-enhanced CT demonstrates a localized fluid collection adjacent to thickened small bowel and reactive mesenteric changes consistent with an inflamed Meckel's diverticulum (surgically confirmed). The focal collection and adjacent bowel wall thickening support the diagnosis.;14495:CT shows a rounded fluid collection with air-fluid level and faecal material near the ileum with minimal fat stranding; differential included ruptured appendix vs Meckel's, with surgery confirming strangulated Meckel's diverticulitis — demonstrates how Meckel can mimic appendiceal abscess on CT.

9848:Large lumbosacral intradural extramedullary mass isointense on T1, hyperintense on T2, with intense post-contrast enhancement and T2* hypointense foci (intratumoral haemorrhage) plus vertebral scalloping and craniospinal dissemination — imaging features of myxopapillary ependymoma that support the diagnosis in the target case.;16402:Well-defined tubular/sausage-shaped long-segment intradural extramedullary lesion within thecal sac that is T2 hyperintense and shows intense homogeneous enhancement, compressing cauda equina — matches the sausage-shaped enhancing L2-L3 lesion in the target and supports ependymoma.

18473:Shoulder MRI shows focal suprascapular nerve enlargement and T2 hyperintensity at the suprascapular notch with acute muscle oedema and chronic fatty atrophy of supraspinatus/infraspinatus — demonstrates the MRI pattern of denervation (acute STIR/T2 hyperintensity followed by chronic T1 fatty replacement) analogous to selective abductor digiti minimi fatty replacement in Baxter neuropathy.;19235:Pelvic MRI demonstrates obturator nerve thickening and T2 hyperintensity where the nerve is encased by iliac adenopathy, with oedema in obturator-innervated muscles and secondary mild fatty atrophy — an example of peripheral nerve entrapment producing selective muscle denervation and fatty replacement, matching the mechanism in Baxter neuropathy.;9784:MR shows increased T2/STIR signal (muscle oedema) and T1 hyperintense fatty infiltration/atrophy of muscles supplied by the anterior interosseous nerve — a clear example of focal motor denervation causing selective fatty muscle replacement, supporting interpretation of abductor digiti minimi fatty change as neurogenic.

15389:TVUS and contrast-enhanced CT show tubular multiloculated adnexal collections with fluid/fluid layering, thick hypervascular septa and thick-enhancing walls — imaging classic for pyosalpinx/tubo-ovarian complex (TOA).;10362:Transvaginal US and contrast-enhanced CT demonstrate an 8-cm multiloculated adnexal complex mass with thickened peripheral wall and contrast-enhancing septa — features typical of tubo-ovarian abscess; adjacency to inflamed sigmoid colon shows secondary TOA from diverticulitis.;9865:Contrast-enhanced CT shows a parauterine fluid collection with internal air and surrounding fat stranding adjacent to sigmoid diverticulitis — presence of internal gas within adnexal collection and inflammatory change strongly supports abscess (tubo-ovarian abscess) rather than neoplasm.

14120:Contrast-enhanced CT angiography shows a lobulated saccular pseudoaneurysm disrupting the basal anterior interventricular septum with a visible defect and direct communication between the LV cavity and the RV — demonstrates how post‑MI septal rupture/pseudoaneurysm appears as a contrast‑filled septal defect connecting ventricles.;13386:Emergency MDCT shows high‑attenuation haemopericardium and contrast extravasation through a full‑thickness discontinuity of the LV free wall into the pericardial sac — exemplary imaging of free‑wall rupture and haemopericardium to differentiate from interventricular septal rupture, which produces intracardiac communication rather than pericardial extravasation.

7137:US images demonstrate multiple serpiginous tubular anechoic structures (dilated ducts) admixed with echogenic stroma and prominent vascular flow on power Doppler, mirroring the target case s lactating ectopic axillary breast tissue features;11598:US shows heterogeneous axillary soft tissue with hypoechoic glandular elements intermixed with echogenic fat, characteristic of accessory breast glandular tissue without the prominent dilated ducts but confirming ectopic location

11296:US shows lobulated hypoechoic soft-tissue mass with marked hypervascularity on power Doppler; MRI T1 hypointense/T2 hyperintense lesion with diffusion restriction and heterogeneous centripetal contrast enhancement (necrotic areas) and PET-CT hypermetabolism — imaging pattern strongly supports malignant small-round-cell tumour (extraskeletal Ewing sarcoma) rather than benign neurogenic lesion.;8549:Contrast CT shows an extrapulmonary paravertebral heterogeneously enhancing soft-tissue mass with no vertebral bone invasion — demonstrates extraskeletal presentation of Ewing sarcoma in soft tissues and differentiates from primary bone Ewing or benign nerve sheath tumours that typically show nerve-related morphology.

13232:CT axial shows decreased L5-S1 intervertebral space, endplate irregularity, and anterior paravertebral soft tissue thickening; MRI sagittal/axial T1/T2 demonstrate low T1/high T2 signal in disc/endplates with enhancement, anterior paravertebral abscess, and fistula tract connecting to sigmoid colon ulcer - directly analogous to duodenal fistula tract opacified by oral contrast leading to paravertebral abscess/disc spaces in target case, confirming bowel perforation as cause of spondylodiscitis;19122:CT coronal/axial shows gas bubbles (arrows) in bilateral psoas muscles and within L3 vertebral body; MRI axial T2 hyperintense multiple round collections in psoas/paraspinal muscles, post-contrast T1 enhancing lesions, sagittal T1 subtle enhancement L2-L5 vertebrae/discs with T2/STIR hyperintensity - matches gas-containing paravertebral collection surrounding aorta L2-L4 extending to disc/epidural spaces in target, confirming pyogenic spondylodiscitis pattern;4822:CT axial shows multiple arrows to free intraperitoneal gas indicating perforated viscus (prepyloric ulcer), L1 inferior endplate destruction with epidural/psoas collections; coronal psoas abscess extension, amorphous peripheral calcifications in psoas abscess - demonstrates association of bowel perforation with spondylodiscitis/psoas abscess but differentiates TB via calcifications from pyogenic Strep anginosus etiology in target

959:Warthin tumor parotid MRI demonstrates low T2 signal intensity lesion (dark mass on axial T2 images 1-2), differing from target acinic cell carcinoma T2 hyperintensity, aiding differentiation from Warthin tumor.

2185:Mammography demonstrates focal parenchymal condensations in the upper outer quadrant (arrows in Image 1) corresponding to palpable lump, matching the target case UOQ asymmetry; ultrasound shows hypoechoic masses with posterior acoustic shadowing (Image 2), similar to target hypoechoic palpable mass with indistinct margins and no vascularity, confirming typical imaging features of diabetic mastopathy (synonymous with lymphocytic mastopathy);8545:Focal asymmetry of density in upper left quadrant on mediolateral oblique mammogram (Image 1), akin to target asymmetry; ultrasound reveals ill-defined markedly hypoechoic area with slight posterior acoustic attenuation (Image 3) underlying palpable mass, directly comparable to target hypoechoic indistinct mass; normal MRI with no enhancement supports benign etiology distinguishing from carcinoma;14178:Mammography shows focal asymmetric densities in upper-outer quadrant (Image 1); ultrasound depicts areas of strong acoustic shadowing without definable masses (Image 3), resembling target large hypoechoic indistinct area; follow-up stability reinforces concordance with benign lymphocytic mastopathy;12236:Mammography exhibits moderate density nodule with ill-defined contours upper outer quadrant (Images 1-2); US confirms hypoechoic nodule with indistinct margins 3cm (Image 3), matching target imaging; follow-up mammogram shows resolution (Image 5), consistent with target resolution post-treatment
